tool.name: VoronoiFromLines

param.name: input_features
param.dialogReference: The input feature classes used to generate the voronoi cells. The input feature must not cross, or overlap. Lines must contains only 2 points.
param.pythonReference: The input feature classes used to generate the voronoi cells. The input feature must not intersect. Lines must contains only 2 points.

param.name: out_featureclass
param.dialogReference: The feature class containing the output cells. Note that more than one cell can be associated with one site.
param.pythonReference: The feature class containing the output cells. Note that more than one cell can be associated with one site.

param.name: curveType
param.dialogReference:
The type of method used to approximate the curves:

  • Straigth: will draw straight line between the curve endpoint and will completely ignore the fact that some edges are actually curves.

  • Approximate: it will use a native method from SharpBoostVoronoi to interpolate points on the curve. Each point will be garanteed to have a maximum distance of the distance between the 2 endpoints divided by 10.

  • Circular: the tool will approximate the curve as a circular shape.

  • Ellipse: the tool will approximate the curve using a ellipse shape.

Any point on the Approximate method is guaranteed to be equidistant from the 2 input sites separated by the cell border.
param.pythonReference:
The type of method used to approximate the curves:

  • Straigth: will draw straight line between the curve endpoint and will completely ignore the fact that some edges are actually curves.

  • Approximate: it will use a native method from SharpBoostVoronoi to interpolate points on the curve. Each point will be garanteed to have a maximum distance of the distance between the 2 endpoints divided by 10.

  • Circular: the tool will approximate the curve as a circular shape.

  • Ellipse: the tool will approximate the curve using a ellipse shape.

Any point on the Approximate method is guaranteed to be equidistant from the 2 input sites separated by the cell border.

tool.summary: This tools generate a cell of voronoi cells from a set of input feature class. Feature classes can be of type points or lines. Lines feature classes must be made of only 2 segments. Input geometries given to the Voronoi tool must not cross, or overlap.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tools generate a cell of voronoi cells from a set of input feature class. Feature classes can be of type points or lines. Lines feature classes must be made of only 2 segments. Input geometries given to the Voronoi tool must not cross, or overlap.

Consts.useLimit: Input data must not cross, or overlap. The boost voronoi library converts input coordinates using a scale factor of 100. The input coordinates system must garantee that any input coordinate multiplied by 100 will not be bigger than a .NET integer (-2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647).
